title: Why doesn't Pyke have a line for Nautilus?
body:
Riot? you just forgot to implement it right? Right? tell me you just forgot riot.

If you're gonna give him the same lore, atleast make them interact. 

######Unless ofcourse you're gonna let my boy sink even deeper and just retcon his lore to replace it with some boring ass "he's a spooky seamonster" lore permanently. Don't ruin my big daddy for me.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Jerry SeinfeId,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-05-15T22:04:42.123+0000)
>
> Riot? you just forgot to implement it right? Right? tell me you just forgot riot.
> 
> If you&#039;re gonna give him the same lore, atleast make them interact. 
> 
> ######Unless ofcourse you&#039;re gonna let my boy sink even deeper and just retcon his lore to replace it with some boring ass &quot;he&#039;s a spooky seamonster&quot; lore permanently. Don&#039;t ruin my big daddy for me.

Why doesn't he have voice lines for almost anyone? His VO is ridiculously bare-bones. Don't expect Riot to respond to any threads about it though. Rioters are cowards who flee in the face of criticism.

> [{quoted}](name=NemeBro,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-05-16T21:33:02.387+0000)
>
> Why doesn't he have voice lines for almost anyone? His VO is ridiculously bare-bones. Don't expect Riot to respond to any threads about it though. Rioters are cowards who flee in the face of criticism.

I posted about this a couple times now. I am a coward (bugs. I hate bugs. Especially butterflies), but not in the face of criticism. 

Also, Pyke and Nautilus haven't crossed paths. The bottom of the sea is a huge place. Very easy for drowned folk to miss each other.

EDIT for clarity: this isn't to say that they will never cross paths, but just to say that I perhaps underestimated the passion of Nautilus mains when writing VO. Lesson learned. EVERY CHAMP WILL HAVE NAUTILUS INTERACTIONS FROM NOW ON.
######no pls don't

> [{quoted}](name=edoxbox1,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2018-05-17T14:23:32.851+0000)
>
> ######no pls don't

TOO LATE.
When the aatrox rework comes out he now has to have an interaction with Nautilus where he just says something like "I'm required to have this interaction with you." Make good on that promise.
He basically did.
New Nunu better have a Naut line
Nununu?
Well... this is my life now.

> [{quoted}](name=FauxSchizzle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-05-17T14:15:17.010+0000)
>
> I posted about this a couple times now. I am a coward (bugs. I hate bugs. Especially butterflies), but not in the face of criticism. 
> 
> Also, Pyke and Nautilus haven't crossed paths. The bottom of the sea is a huge place. Very easy for drowned folk to miss each other.
> 
> EDIT for clarity: this isn't to say that they will never cross paths, but just to say that I perhaps underestimated the passion of Nautilus mains when writing VO. Lesson learned. EVERY CHAMP WILL HAVE NAUTILUS INTERACTIONS FROM NOW ON.

So let me understand this - Pyke has crossed paths with {{champion:22}}, who lives on a completely different continent, who pretty much stays there trying to unify the people on that continent, yet he hasn't crossed paths with {{champion:111}} or even {{champion:223}}, who both haunt the back allies and waters of Bilgewater?

Even if he HASN'T met {{champion:111}} or {{champion:223}}, their sheer proximity and the fact that there would be legends and tales about the demon catfish who grants wishes and a fellow drowned seaman who pulls ships under would be enough for Pyke to have at the very least heard of them and have lines for them should he ever encounter them. This statement that he hasn't crossed paths with Nautilus makes little sense when Pyke has lines for Ashe.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=000100000004,timestamp=2018-05-17T16:45:32.002+0000)
>
> So let me understand this - Pyke has crossed paths with {{champion:22}}, who lives on a completely different continent, who pretty much stays there trying to unify the people on that continent, yet he hasn't crossed paths with {{champion:111}} or even {{champion:223}}, who both haunt the back allies and waters of Bilgewater?
> 
> Even if he HASN'T met {{champion:111}} or {{champion:223}}, their sheer proximity and the fact that there would be legends and tales about the demon catfish who grants wishes and a fellow drowned seaman who pulls ships under would be enough for Pyke to have at the very least heard of them and have lines for them should he ever encounter them. This statement that he hasn't crossed paths with Nautilus makes little sense when Pyke has lines for Ashe.

Pyke recognizes Ashe as a leader. Not by reputation. He's defining the word for himself and now it relates to his motives.

Just to clarify, VOs aren't necessarily always canon, correct? They are sometimes "what if" representations of what a champ would say if they encountered another champ that they haven't or may never encounter.

> [{quoted}](name=FauxSchizzle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=0001000000040000,timestamp=2018-05-17T17:01:28.047+0000)
>
> Pyke recognizes Ashe as a leader. Not by reputation. He's defining the word for himself and now it relates to his motives.

We barely recognize Ashe as more than a wisp of a girl with a bow, let alone as a leader. Unless she's talked to Pyke, it isn't obviously apparent that she's any kind of authority figure. Him recognizing Ashe as a leader makes even less sense than him recognizing Nautilus and Tahm, because at least they have very distinctive looks that would cause instant recognition if he encountered them based on what he would have heard of them. And given that he's even turned to Kalista for vengeance (considering his voice line to her) why would he not consider the opportunity to employ Kench? 

The main point is, why was Ashe so much more of an inclusion in his VO than 2 vastly more relevant champs he would see in his main lane?
So Pyke doesn't hang around Bilgewater much?

They will cross paths in game though, are both characters of legends for the same region (Bilgewater), and share a similar fate. 

This is kind of like Irelia not having lines for a bunch of Ionian champions... those are narrative gaps that should never exist in the first place. You guys spend months writing for these characters, this is a pretty blatant omission especially after the whole Nautilus-lore ask that happened.

I think one of y'all mentioned not having crossed paths as a reason Swain didn't get an interaction with Kled, either.

Thing is, I feel like in-game interactions are actually a _prime opportunity_ to do voice lines that are just that; interactions between champs that have never and perhaps even would never come across one another. It helps develop a sense of how the champ(s) _would_ interact, how they would feel about one another, etc., as well as further fleshing out the attitudes of the champ in question. Pyke with Naut and Swain with Kled are in particular missed opportunities. There's an obvious similarity between Pyke's and Naut's backgrounds, and I feel a lot of people were looking forward to how Pyke at least would feel about their similarities and differences, even if it's an ultimately non-canon game line.

Same thing for Kled and Swain... I at least was looking forward to seeing how the Grand General of Noxus would react to someone who, in theory, is supposed to be the ultimate expression of Noxian values.

Heck, not having come across each other hasn't stopped you guys in the past when coming up with VO. I doubt Urgot has any idea Teemo exists, for example, or Yorick with Amumu, and A Sol probably doesn't give a damn about anyone not of Targon or perhaps the Void. A hefty chunk of Zoe's VO is her commentary on a whole relationship between people who have likely never met, for that matter.

This isn't to say every champ should have interactions with every other champ, of course. That would be too much. And I'll admit, I could well be talking out of my ass here. But if it helps develop a character's personality in some way, such as revealing some trait of their personality or how they would see such-and-such champ, or if it's even just a fun bit of meta-commentary, I'd say even a Kench-tier VO is nothing to shy away from. Even if it isn't entirely canon, it's still fun.

> [{quoted}](name=Cetri,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2018-05-17T14:59:09.921+0000)
>
> I think one of y'all mentioned not having crossed paths as a reason Swain didn't get an interaction with Kled, either.
> 
> Thing is, I feel like in-game interactions are actually a _prime opportunity_ to do voice lines that are just that; interactions between champs that have never and perhaps even would never come across one another. It helps develop a sense of how the champ(s) _would_ interact, how they would feel about one another, etc., as well as further fleshing out the attitudes of the champ in question. Pyke with Naut and Swain with Kled are in particular missed opportunities. There's an obvious similarity between Pyke's and Naut's backgrounds, and I feel a lot of people were looking forward to how Pyke at least would feel about their similarities and differences, even if it's an ultimately non-canon game line.
> 
> Same thing for Kled and Swain... I at least was looking forward to seeing how the Grand General of Noxus would react to someone who, in theory, is supposed to be the ultimate expression of Noxian values.
> 
> Heck, not having come across each other hasn't stopped you guys in the past when coming up with VO. I doubt Urgot has any idea Teemo exists, for example, or Yorick with Amumu, and A Sol probably doesn't give a damn about anyone not of Targon or perhaps the Void. A hefty chunk of Zoe's VO is her commentary on a whole relationship between people who have likely never met, for that matter.
> 
> This isn't to say every champ should have interactions with every other champ, of course. That would be too much. And I'll admit, I could well be talking out of my ass here. But if it helps develop a character's personality in some way, such as revealing some trait of their personality or how they would see such-and-such champ, or if it's even just a fun bit of meta-commentary, I'd say even a Kench-tier VO is nothing to shy away from. Even if it isn't entirely canon, it's still fun.

They've claimed in the past that some of the more strange interactions are "what ifs" if those champs crossed paths with others, like Braum and Illaoi or some such.

> [{quoted}](name=FauxSchizzle,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-05-17T14:15:17.010+0000)
>

> 
> Also, Pyke and Nautilus haven't crossed paths. The bottom of the sea is a huge place. Very easy for drowned folk to miss each other.
> 
> EDIT for clarity: this isn't to say that they will never cross paths, but just to say that I perhaps underestimated the passion of Nautilus mains when writing VO. Lesson learned. EVERY CHAMP WILL HAVE NAUTILUS INTERACTIONS FROM NOW ON.

So I forgot to respond to this and was reminded by checking my inbox, but are you for real?

That's what you're going with? They haven't crossed paths?

Has Kai'sa crossed paths with Jax? Or Jinx? Or Miss Fortune? 

Has Evelynn ever crossed paths with fucking Amumu? Or Bard?

Has Xayah run into AURELION SOL somewhere in Ionia trying to lead her people in an uprising?

My friend, I am far too smart for your typical Rioter tomfoolery to have any effect on me.
Rioters apparently flee in the face of butterflies rather.

> [{quoted}](name=IcyPepper,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=AJcIJZ0Z,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2018-05-17T16:47:09.697+0000)

http://image.ec21.com/image/eliya/oimg_GC02339115_CA02451157/Evil_Butterfly_Buckle.jpg
Oh Jesus now I know where he's coming from.
Idk but I believe that he could have had waaaaaaay more champion interactions...
